column3: str

Vuyargur seeks a pair of burly biceps to do his bidding.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the culinary courier in Worlar's Echo.
Carry the stone box of foodstuffs to Garharlor.
Speak with Vuyargur.
Good timing, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. With the brawniest of my kin otherwise occupied with construction, I would prevail upon your strength.
Some time ago I sent a courier to fetch culinary supplies for the larder, but I suspect he may be too heavily encumbered.
If you could seek him out in Worlar's Echo, we would be most grateful for your helping hands.
Are you here to help me? Oh, thank the ancestors.
I was so giddy about the restoration of the larder, I went around telling everyone I could find, and they showered me in foodstuffs to bring back!
It seems everyone's keen to see us complete the restoration of Zirgorteh the Open-armed, for I've been given another mountain of foodstuffs to bring back!
Not to be ungrateful, but I can only carry about ten of these heavy stone boxes, and I'll need to walk slowly, lest I drop the whole stack down the mountain.
Think you could deliver one to Garharlor over in Shelter? Your muscles may not thank you, but everyone else surely will!
Heavy, aren't they? You'll get the hang of it! Here, try again!
How fares the culinary courier?
Collect the stone box of foodstuffs from the culinary courier and deliver it here to Garharlor.
Ah, this must be the delivery I requested. Much obliged.
Let's see here. Corn, beans, popotoes...and spices too!? Why, the box is stuffed to bursting!
These are all pantry staples─ingredients commonly used in our most beloved Yok Huy soups. A generous offering indeed.
Mmm... Smell that? With this much sweet corn, no belly shall go unfilled.
Come to think of it, you weren't harassed by hungry alpacas on the road, were you? Perhaps we should be grateful that these stone boxes form an airtight seal...
This looks to be tulidile jerky─the perfect staple for a larder, given its long shelf life.
That said, I can't imagine something as delicious as jerky will go uneaten for long. Certainly not if I have the opportunity. <chuckle>
Right then, that will be all I require of you. Speak to Vuyargur for your reward!
Go and collect your reward from Vuyargur. You've earned it, my friend!
Enjoyed some light exercise, did you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Rest those weary arms for as long as you like─but first, accept your reward with my thanks.
